page.title: 01The Parish of Soulby
page.content: The block corresponds approximately to the Parish of Soulby, with the village towards the SE corner. The land falls from 750' in the NW to 450' in the SE, down to the valley of the River Eden. The dozen or so farms in the area are primarily concerned with milk production, but almost all also run a flock of sheep. Consequently cultivation is almost entirely of grassland, with the occasional field used for fodder grain. Apart from the odd small copse or windbreak, there is no woodland but hedgerows & roadside verges have many trees in great variety. The village of Soulby, little changed since the war, is a farming village, split into two unequal parts by Scandal Beck. Extensive village greens on either side of the beck are cropped by horses, goats and geese.
